newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia's Tudjman recovered after illness - doctors.
newsitem.headline: Croatia's Tudjman recovered after illness - doctors.

text.p: Croatia's president Franjo Tudjman, recently elected for a second term in office, has successfully completed medical treatment and is fit to perform all his duties, state news agency HINA reported on Saturday.

The president's medical council, assisted by experts from France and Germany, carried out final check-ups and a number of diagnostic tests at the end of his medical treatment, a council statement carried by HINA said.
"The council has concluded that there are no traces of the previous illness and that the applied treatment was successfully completed," the statement said. It did not say what the illness was.
Tudjman, who noticeably lost weight last year, was treated at a U.S. military hospital in Washington in November for what U.S. sources said was stomach cancer.
Tudjman's office never confirmed this and described his ailment as stomach ulcers and swollen lymphoid nodes.
The-75-year old president's distinctive mane of silver hair has thinned considerably during the treatment but he appears to have regained weight and regularly plays tennis.
"The president can perform all his duties without any restrictions," the statement said.
